title: Theodore Roosevelt National Park: Cottonwood Campground
body: Cottonwood Campground       Cottonwood Campground - South Unit   The Cottonwood Campground is located six miles from the South Unit park entrance. Half of the sites are first-come, first-served and half are now reservable.  Open Year-Round Information: 701-623-4466 General Information Sites: 76, pull-through, back-in, and walk-in sites Group Sites: 1 site reservable (see below for information) Reservations: 37 sites reservable. Contact recreation.gov or call 1-877-444-6777. Fees: $14 per night summer season, $7 per night winter season. Summer rates are in effect. Discounts: Senior Pass or Access Pass holders receive a 50% discount. Maximum occupancy: 1 family or 6 people Facilities Restrooms: Flush toilets during main visitor season, pit toilet available year-round  Drinking Water: Spigots located throughout campground Showers: No RV Information Dump Station: No (A public dump station is available in Medora.) Water Fill Station: Yes Electric hookups: No Sewer hookups: No Water hookups: No Cottonwood Group Site Information: The Cottonwood Group Site is available by reservation only for groups of 7 to 20 people. Cost is $30 per night. Reservations can be made online at recreation.gov or by calling 1-877-444-6777. (Theodore Roosevelt National Park cannot make reservations.)
